basics.name: Santiago Price Torrendell
basics.label: Mechanical Engineer
basics.summary: An Argentinian Mechanical Engineer deeply interested on mechatronics devices to empower people.

location.address: Amakubo 2-1-1, University of Tsukuba, Oikoshy Dormitory 17, 209

work.name: Systems and Information Engimeering Graduate School, University of Tsukuba
work.position: PhD Student at the Artificial Intelligence Laboratory
work.summary: Development and Evaluation of a Passive Neck Brace for Persons with Dropped Head Sindrome

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

publications.name: A Neck Orthosis With Multi-Directional Variable Stiffness for Persons With Dropped Head Syndrome}
publications.summary: This work proposes a novel soft orthosis to assist the head movement of person with DHS. The experiment with non-affected persons suggests the system provides suitable support for the end users. On the sagittal plane, the support is adjustable and do not restrics mobility. Horizontally the system permits free neck rotations.

publications.name: Design of a Multi-Degree-of-Freedom Elastic Neck Exoskeleton for Persons with Dropped Head Syndrome
publications.publisher: Proc. of Annual International Conference of the IEEE Engineering in Medicine and Biology Society (EMBC)}

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
